interesting points: The witnesses described the objects as resembling the cover of a garbage can or a barrel top, with a yellowish color comparable to the moon.
One of the witnesses reported that the object traveled at a terrific speed, leaving a yellowish, tapering trail comparable to the flame of improperly combusting gas.
The object appeared to be approximately 15 inches in diameter at an estimated distance of about 20 miles and an angle of 45Â° above the horizon.

An individual stated that he had seen two 'flying saucers' going southwest, very fast, with a general outline resembling a flattened funnel, and believed that the information should be used as these might be some of the first sightings in the area.
The report includes a sketch made by a witness of the objects seen on 15 and 28 March 1949, implying that there was an attempt to visually document the sightings.
